provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Registration of Titles
Regulations, 1914.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. A certificate of title shall not include more than one parcel of
land except as hereinafter mentioned unless the Registrar of Titles shall
otherwise direct.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3. A certificate of title may include two or more parcels of land
which are oontiguous.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4. A certificate of title may include two or more parcels of land
which are not contiguous if they are situated in the same parish and
are held and worked together as one estate such as a sugar estate with
detached wharf land or detached mountain land.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. Any person applying for one certificate of title in respect of two
or more parcels of land or of lands described in two or more parcels
must satisfy the Registrar of Titles in such manner as he may require
that such parcels may be included in one certificate of title.

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6. The severance of lands by a road or such like shall not render
such lands discontiguous within the meaning of these Regulations.
